title: College Football: Multiple fans injured from Iowa State stadium fall
text:
Iowa State plays Oklahoma State at Jack Trice Stadium during the first half of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, Oct. 26, 2019, in Ames, Iowa. (Photo: Matthew Putney/AP)

Iowa State University acknowledged Monday that multiple people were injured when a fan tumbled from the upper deck of Jack Trice Stadium during Saturday’s football game against Oklahoma State.

A witness to the incident, Maury Ruble, 47, of Ogden, said he was sitting directly behind the fan who fell.

"He was really animated and conversational, just enjoying the game," Ruble recalled.

Ruble said Iowa State missed a possible interception sometime during the first quarter when the fall occurred.

"He stood up emphatically, leaning forward. I looked to my left at my wife and son real quick, and when I looked back there was a void where he was," Ruble said. "It happened in an instant."

The gentleman sitting to the left of the fallen fan, according to Ruble, looked at him and said: "He just went over."

"I was completely flabbergasted. It was unbelievable," Ruble said. "There is no question that this was just a freak accident."

"Everyone in the section was looking around each other in disbelief, some had stood up to look over the railing to see what happened," Ruble said. Bystanders talked among themselves, putting the pieces together.

Ruble himself looked over the railing, and saw the man lying on his back with his legs "kind of crossed" at the ankles.

"My family has had tickets every year since Jack Trice has been open, since day one," Ruble said. "I've seen a lot of things in the stadium, but nothing like this."

In an email to The Des Moines Register, Angie Hunt, interim director of the Iowa State University News Service, provided additional details from what was released Sunday.

“Iowa State University is in contact with the individuals involved in an accident Saturday at Jack Trice Stadium.

“A fan fell from the second balcony on the stadium’s east side in the first half of the football game versus Oklahoma State. The fan landed on fans sitting in the lower bowl. Emergency medical professionals immediately responded and provided treatment.

“University leaders express their concern and hope for a quick recovery for all those involved. The names of the injured individuals are not being released at this time.”

The university’s response provided the first official acknowledgement that more than one person was hurt during the at least 25-foot fall during a game that was attended by a 61,500-person sellout crowd.

Iowa State University police, which has jurisdiction of the stadium, didn’t respond to emails Monday seeking a copy of the incident report.

When contacted Sunday, ISU Police Chief Michael Newton declined to comment, calling it an open investigation.
description: Iowa State University's response Monday provided the first official acknowledgement that more than one person was hurt during a fan's 25-foot fall.
